Key Match Events: The Thunder dominated the Nuggets en route to a 102-87 win.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander tallied 28 markers, eight assists and seven rebounds, and Chet Holmgren had 25 points, 14 boards and four blocks.
Pre-Game Insights: The Nuggets faced concerns, especially regarding their bench depth.
Nikola Jokic told Denver media they need to improve across the board.
Post-Match Reflections: Nikola Jokic says the Nuggets need to improve on everything after rough preseason
Nikola Jokic told Denver media they need to improve across the board.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets and Thunder tied for the best record in the West at 57-25, with OKC claiming the top seed due to the tiebreaker.
The Nuggets ranked last in 3-pointers attempted, averaging just 31.2 per game, and were second to last in free throws attempted at 19.9 per game.
Others: Nikola Jokic had a challenging preseason, with the Nuggets posting a 1-4 record.
Russell Westbrook, in his Nuggets debut, shot 2-for-10 and finished with six points.
Jamal Murray and Aaron Gordon had 12 points, Michael Porter Jr. had 15 and Christian Braun added 16.
